p: Overall, 3 proteins involved in cytoskeletal organization were upregulated in Caki-1 cells and the relative ratios were all >1.5 at the three time points ( Fig. 7B). Among them, Î±-actinin-1 (ACTN1) cross-linked with the actin cytoskeleton, through cadherin, integrins, vinculin, catenin or talin, and mediated the adhesion of adjacent cells or the adhesion of cells to the extracellular matrix ( 22). In addition, following the induction of apoptosis, the level of ACTN1 differed more markedly ( Fig. 7B). Additionally, the expression of COL1A1, which can promote cell adhesion and cell proliferation, was also increased ( 23). The cytoskeletal PDZ-LIM protein family has a PDZ domain with a scaffolding function through which the coordinated assembly of proteins can occur. These results indicate that XIAP participates in cytoskeletal regulation through ACTN1, COL1A1 and PDLIM7.
